column4: I accidentally upgraded to hoary... and I'm wondering how to roll back to warty
well, on purpose.. but now I realize I really didn't want to do that at all
damn... and we lost synaptic.. and .. it's bad
I guess the best bet is to just reinstall?
if you have /home on a seperate partition it can be less insane
you can backup certain bits of configuration (dpkg --get-selections for example)
that my friend uses who is more ubuntu-smart than me
we're just going to reinstall, copy the sources.list down, and go from there
dpkg --get-selections spits out the list of installed packages
shouldn't be that big of a deal since it's a relatively fresh install
you can also back up bits of /etc you know you modified
the beauty is that the install is barely customized. it's not a big deal at all
